oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Synthesis of a C-Glycoside Analogue of beta-Galactosyl Ceramide, a Potential HIV-1 Entry Inhibitor
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: THOTA, VN
BRAHMAIAH, M
KULKARNI, SS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: OLEFIN CROSS-METATHESIS
ASYMMETRIC DIHYDROXYLATION
ESSENTIAL COMPONENT
RECEPTOR
GP120
BINDING
GLYCOSPHINGOLIPIDS
BENZYLIDENE
RETROVIRUS
MIMETICS
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A beta-C-galactosyl ceramide was synthesized in a stereoselective manner, employing a Sharpless AD reaction and olefin cross metathesis as key steps.
